required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Extended Release Naltrexone for Opioid-Dependent Youth
clinical_study.official_title: Health Services Research: Extended Release Naltrexone for Opioid-Dependent Youth

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare 6-month treatment outcomes for 15-21 year old opioid-dependent youth receiving extended release naltrexone (XR-NTX) v. Treatment as Usual (TAU).

detailed_description.textblock: This proposed study is a 6-month, two-group randomized clinical trial of XR-NTX v. TAU for 340 opioid-dependent youth ages 15-21. The study will be conducted at Mountain Manor Treatment Center, a community drug treatment program in Baltimore. TAU will consist of buprenorphine treatment of opioid withdrawal followed by counseling with or without continued buprenorphine.

primary_outcome.description: To determine the relative effectiveness of XR-NTX compared to TAU for opioid-dependent youth in terms of opioid use at 6-months post-treatment entry.

secondary_outcome.description: To determine the relative effectiveness of XR-NTX compared to TAU for opioid-dependent youth in terms of days in treatment. Treatment defined as medications for OUD received in past 30 days at 6-month follow-up.
The cost-effectiveness will be assessed using the Economic Form 90 to collect data on economic outcomes of health utilization at 6 months.

To examine the impact of XR-NTX on HIV sex-risk behaviors at 6 months. Past 90 days self-reported HIV sex risk behaviors on the Risk Assessment Battery (RAB). Minimum value 0; maximum value 24. Higher scores reflect endorsement of more risk behaviors (worse outcome).

arm_group.description: Participants randomly assigned to XR-NTX who do not have opioid withdrawal signs or symptoms within 4 hours of administration of the 25 mg oral dose naltrexone will be given an intramuscular injection of XR-NTX [VivitrolÂ®] at a dose of 4cc (380mg of naltrexone)] and will subsequently have the same dose administered to alternating sides of the buttocks every four weeks for up to 6 months. All participants will also receive psychosocial treatment.

Participants randomly assigned to TAU will participate in the standard youth opioid program at the treatment center which includes either buprenorphine taper or ongoing buprenorphine treatment during the 6 months of the study for as long as they and their physicians think is appropriate. The general target dose will be 12-20 mg buprenorphine per day. All participants in TAU will receive psychosocial treatment.

intervention.description: naltrexone for extended release injectable suspension
Psychosocial treatment will consist of group and individual drug abuse counseling at MMTC and in the community.

Participants assigned to TAU will receive buprenorphine for opioid withdrawal and will either be tapered off the medication or will remain on it for individualized lengths of time during the six month study.

All participants will also receive psychosocial treatment. Buprenorphine: Participants assigned to TAU will receive buprenorphine for opioid withdrawal and will either be tapered off the medication or will remain on it for individualized lengths of time during the six month study.

measure.title: Opioid Use at 6 Month Follow-up
measure.description: To determine the relative effectiveness of XR-NTX compared to TAU for opioid-dependent youth in terms of opioid use at 6-months post-treatment entry.

outcome.title: Treatment Retention
outcome.description: To determine the relative effectiveness of XR-NTX compared to TAU for opioid-dependent youth in terms of days in treatment. Treatment defined as medications for OUD received in past 30 days at 6-month follow-up.
outcome.population: Participants who completed 6-month follow-up assessment with complete data.

outcome.title: HIV Sex Risk Behaviors
outcome.description: To examine the impact of XR-NTX on HIV sex-risk behaviors at 6 months. Past 90 days self-reported HIV sex risk behaviors on the Risk Assessment Battery (RAB). Minimum value 0; maximum value 24. Higher scores reflect endorsement of more risk behaviors (worse outcome).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: There was poor participant adherence to receiving the randomly assigned condition prior to inpatient discharge. For this reason, great caution is urged in interpreting outcomes based on study condition as assigned.
